thread.title: Galliford Try wins contract in GBP150m hospital redevelopment
thread.title_full: Galliford Try wins contract in GBP150m hospital redevelopment

title: Galliford Try wins contract in GBP150m hospital redevelopment
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Thu, Oct 8, 2015, 16:29 BST - UK Markets close in 1 min. Galliford Try wins contract in GBP150m hospital redevelopment By Edward Swift | Sharecast – 7 hours ago 1,592.00 +5.0000 
LONDON (ShareCast) - (ShareCast News) - Galliford Try (LSE: GFRD.L - news ) has been appointed to support the £150m site-wide redevelopment of Luton and Dunstable University Hospital. The FTSE 250 company announced on Thursday has been appointed preferred supply chain partner under the ProCure21+ framework. 
The housebuilding and construction group said the main programme, which will be completed in 2019 includes a new £80m block for all critical care, surgery and other complex care procedures. 
It (Other OTC: ITGL - news ) also includes replacing several wards and the site's energy centre and completely refurbishing the emergency department. 
Work will also begin immediately to deliver a new £6m office block to enable delivery of the main works. 
Chief executive Peter Truscott said the scheme is prestigious and one of the largest in the ProCure21+ framework. 
"Galliford Try has a growing presence in the healthcare market and this is an excellent opportunity to demonstrate our capability in delivering complex public sector healthcare projects (Other OTC: UBGXF - news ) ."
